brieﬂy introduce special mappings.
Deﬁnition 2.16 (Injective, Surjective, Bijective). Consider a mapping Φ :
V→W , where V,Wcan be arbitrary sets. Then Φ is called
injective
Injective if ∀x,y∈V : Φ(x) = Φ(y) =⇒ x= y.surjective
Surjective if Φ(V) = W.bijective
Bijective if it is injective and surjective.
Draft (2019-10-15) of “Mathematics for Machine Learning”. Feedback:https://mml-book.com.
